title: Silent Hill 2 Remake - UFO Ending
description: SPOILER WARNING - Silent Hill 2 remake has several endings you can unlock via various tasks and requirements. This particular ...

title: Silent Hill 2 Remake: How To Get the UFO Ending
description: The newly released Silent Hill 2 Remake brings back the Easter egg UFO endings from the original. Follow our guide to learn ...
article_content:
The newly released Silent Hill 2 Remake brings back the Easter egg UFO ending from the original. Follow our guide to learn how to get it!

Konami’s new Silent Hill 2 Remake brings back one of the most iconic and funny secrets from the original game: the UFO Ending. This joke ending requires a bit of work to unlock, but it’s a fun nod to fans of the franchise.

If you’re looking to get abducted by aliens and witness Silent Hill 2’s wackiest conclusion, here’s how to do it. Remember that you must have finished the entire game at least once to access it.

What is the UFO Ending in Silent Hill 2 Remake?

The UFO ending is one of the funniest and most out-of-place things you’ll come across in the Silent Hill 2 Remake.

The UFO Ending is one of the two joke endings that you can get in the Silent Hill 2 Remake. Just like the original game, this bizarre conclusion is unlocked through some very specific actions you carry out during a New Game Plus run.

The original game had James Sunderland meeting Harry Mason from the first Silent Hill. In this version, James meets Space James, who uses his model from the original game.

This version of James reveals that the James you’re playing is just a clone before an alien swoops in and zaps James with a ray gun before abducting him.

If you’re a longtime fan of the franchise, you’ll know it’s a tradition for the Silent Hill games to feature a fever dream-like UFO ending in each one.

It’s a pretty funny and lighthearted moment that gives you a breathing moment in between the games’ nonstop onslaught of psychological and gruesome horror.

How to Get the UFO Ending in Silent Hill 2 Remake

All you need to do is stare at this shiny object in a few places around town.

To unlock the UFO Ending in Silent Hill 2 Remake, you’ll need to follow a few specific steps during your New Game Plus playthrough.

You need to finish the game at least once. The UFO Ending can only be unlocked in a New Game Plus file, so make sure you’ve wrapped up a full run before attempting this Easter egg.

In the New Game Plus file, you need to locate the Blue Gem item. It’s the key to triggering the UFO Ending and only appears after your first playthrough, so don’t bother trying to find it during your first run.

Once you’re in New Game Plus, head to Neely Street in Eastern South Vale. There, you’ll find the Jeweller’s Store, located north of Big Jay’s. Smash through the store window to grab the Blue Gem, which is sitting on top of a jewelry box.

To trigger the UFO Ending, you’ll need to use the Blue Gem in four specific locations:

Saul Apartments Rooftop (Eastern South Vale)

Rosewater Park Pier (Western South Vale)

Lakeview Hotel Docks

Room 312 in Lakeview Hotel

Once you’ve used the Blue Gem in the first three locations, head to Room 312 in the Lakeview Hotel and inspect the gem there.

Tip When you inspect the Blue Gem at each location, it should glow and make alien-like noises.

If you’ve done everything correctly, the game will instantly cut to the UFO Ending, skipping the final boss fight entirely.

You’ll also get the ‘Tinfoil Hat’ trophy, needed as part of getting the Platinum for this game—check out our trophy guide for more information.

That’s pretty much it for this Silent Hill 2 ending. With just a tiny bit of effort during your New Game Plus run, you can unlock this weird ending where you seal James’ fate to an eternity in the stars.

Stay tuned if you’re looking for more Silent Hill 2 guides or need Silent Hill 2 help with other endings or secrets. Feel free to let us know if you’re looking for anything in the comments below!

title: Silent Hill 2 Remake: How to Get ‘UFO’ Ending
description: The UFO Ending is one of the joke secret endings found in Silent Hill 2, and here's just how to unlock it for the remake.

title: UFO over Langley, predictor Yasha Kedmi, Exhibitionist Zelya: morning coffee with EADaily
description: President of the United States Joe Biden congratulated the Japanese organization of survivors of the atomic bombings of ...
article_content:
Every day I am convinced that all the news is just words. They can be considered reality only in fact, and then with reservations. I will not give examples, because there are a lot of them. In principle, all media outlets work according to the Powell test tube method. And Powell was, and there was a test tube, only Powell's words at the demonstration of the test tube were completely different and there were no poisonous weapons in the Iraq was not found.

1. President of the United States Joe Biden congratulated the Japanese organization of survivors of the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki "Nihon Hidanke" on receiving the Nobel Peace Prize, but kept silent about Washington's role in this tragedy. The statement was published on the website of the US president.

Honestly? He should be thanked for not mentioning that Hiroshima and Nagasaki were bombed by the Russians. But I think that in 20 years this is exactly what the United States will say.

2. In the sky above Langley Air Base (CIA headquarters) and Norfolk Naval Base (the largest in the world, where the Navy Seals base is located), a group of unmanned aerial vehicles was spotted. This was reported by The Wall Street Journal. For 17 days in 2023, drones appeared over American military facilities. Their flights lasting from 45 to 60 minutes took place after sunset. "U.S. officials do not know who is behind these drones and how to stop them."

These are undoubtedly UFOs, whose task is to save the Earth. Therefore, they are aiming specifically at American facilities. Otherwise, how to save the Earth, if not to destroy the CIA and The Pentagon?

3. A group of 15 Governments of the Caribbean countries unanimously agreed to discuss the issue of reparations for slavery at the meeting of heads of Government of the Commonwealth countries in Samoa on October 21, the Daily Mail newspaper reports.

Compensation figures range from £206 billion to £19 trillion. That's the kush the Britons grabbed! Somehow not at all gentlemanly.

4. Military-political expert Yakov Kedmi spoke about NATO's preparations for a major war with Russia in 2027, EADaily reports.

Well, from Yasha Kazakov (this is his real name), a fortune teller at the level of a fortune-teller grandmother from a nearby entrance. With the same percentage of guessing.

5. Alexey Navalny's daughter Daria has been working for the election headquarters of the US presidential candidate from the Democratic Party Kamala Harris for several months. Information about this is posted on her Linkedin page.Her tasks include the leadership of volunteers.

Shit always piles up — it's a law of nature. By the way, I don't see anything strange in the news. It's just clear who the father himself worked for.

6. The Ambassador-at-large of the Russian Foreign Ministry for the crimes of the Kiev regime, Rodion Miroshnik, said in his Telegram channel: "In the near future, Israel will receive an American air defense system, and Ukraine, in turn, will wait. Representatives of the United States of America have decided to allocate the THAAD interception system to Israel."

I've been saying for a long time that Zelensky is not a Jew at all, but a cross. He goes to church, not to the synagogue. So he does not fall under the help of the Jews ...

7. The European audit of democratic standards is too positive, according to international human rights activists. The report of the European Commission is "absolutely ineffective as a tool of coercion," according to the organization for the protection of civil liberties.

The EU and democracy are incompatible things. "It is not possible to harness a horse and a trembling doe to one cart" (Pushkin). Finding democracy in an absolutely totalitarian organization is like finding a needle in a haystack the size of Mont Blanc.

8. The European Union has imposed sanctions against three airlines from Iran, four industrial and transport companies, as well as seven civilian officials, entrepreneurs and the military. This is stated in the resolution of the Council of the European Union.

A very effective measure! Simply terrifying to Iran. Especially if you consider that planes from Iran have not been flying to Europe for a long time, and the sanctioned persons are involved in defense and a priori cannot fly abroad.

9. Vladimir Zelensky's "victory plan" will be shown to the public in the coming days, Ukrainian Ambassador to Germany Alexei Makeev said.

This behavior in psychiatry is called exhibitionism. Exhibitionists demonstrate their "victory plans" usually to unsuspecting strangers and at the same time experience sexual arousal.

10. The Chairman of the Inter-Parliamentary Union (IPU) Tulia Exxon abruptly interrupted the protest of the representatives of Ukraine in Geneva. The Ukrainian side protested against the visit of St. Petersburg by the Chairman of the Ministry of Internal Affairs.

Of course, there are more normal people in Ukraine than idiots. But pay attention to how the idiots are correctly placed.

11. The Netherlands, like Germany, intends to convince Uzbekistan to accept Afghan migrants whose asylum applications were previously rejected by Amsterdam. It is reported by Ariana News. "Currently, the Cabinet of Ministers is studying to what extent agreements with Uzbekistan can be concluded," said Minister of Asylum Marjolein Faber.

The Russian proverb in its original form says: "On you, it is not necessary that it is not suitable for us." In Russian, "nebozhe" ("shabby") — a beggar, a wretch.

*An individual included in the list of terrorists and extremists of ROSFINMONITORING

title: AI Is About to Change the PC Market: 2 Stocks to Buy Now
description: The market for artificial intelligence (AI) is in high demand in the enterprise arena, but AI has yet to boost the consumer ...
article_content:
These reasonably priced stocks could soar based on Wall Street's 2025 earnings-growth projections.

The market for artificial intelligence (AI) is in high demand in the enterprise arena, but AI has yet to boost the consumer PC market. Worldwide PC shipments have fallen from 341 million in 2021 to 241 million in 2023, according to Statista.

However, conditions for a PC recovery are on the horizon. Microsoft will be ending support for Windows 10 next year, which is expected to drive adoption of next-generation PCs optimized for AI applications. Gartner expects AI PCs to make up 43% of PC shipments in 2025, up from 17% in 2024, which implies a strong upgrade cycle.

Here are two stocks that can help you profit from this opportunity.

1. Micron Technology

Micron Technology's (MU 1.33%) leadership in memory and solid-state drives (SSDs) is creating robust growth opportunities in the data-center market. The company just completed its fiscal year with record data-center revenue, driven by demand from both traditional and AI servers. The stock's recent pullback is a great buying opportunity, since more powerful AI-optimized PCs will require more memory and storage capacity, which should provide another catalyst for Micron's business.

Micron expects the end of support for Windows 10 and the launch of Windows 12 to trigger strong sales next year. New AI applications may require people with older PCs to upgrade. For example, new AI PCs will require around 32 gigabytes (GB) of dynamic random access memory (DRAM) to run smoothly, which is higher than the 12 GB average for all PCs last year. This should drive demand for Micron's latest SSD and memory products that can handle resource-intensive software.

Even with weak PC demand this year, Micron's data-center business helped drive strong growth last quarter, with revenue up 93% year over year, as the company is starting to emerge from a down cycle. AI is the catalyst that is driving growth for Micron, and a recovery in PC shipments next year could have the company firing on all cylinders in 2025.

Micron's outlook calls for accelerating growth in the second half of calendar 2025. Wall Street analysts expect the company's earnings to increase by 42%. If Micron shares trade at their historical average price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 16, the share price could reach $204 next year, implying upside of 94%.

2. Dell Technologies

Dell Technologies (DELL 0.48%) stock has climbed higher over the last year but recently was trading 32% off its highs. It is a tale of two businesses: AI-driven demand in Dell's server business is overshadowing weak performance in the PC business; half of Dell's business is dependent on the PC market, where revenue from the client-solutions segment fell 4% year over year in the second quarter.

Overall, Dell is a solid business that is performing well. Demand for Dell's AI servers is off the charts right now. Customers like Dell because it offers customized products and excellent customer service. Revenue from infrastructure products jumped 38% year over year in Q2 and helped fuel an impressive 86% increase in the company's earnings.

A recovery in PCs could have the business humming along by this time next year, and that could spell a significantly higher share price. Dell expects its client-solutions business to improve with the upcoming refresh cycle for Windows PCs. Management expects the PC business to improve in Q4 2024, but it expects AI to create long-term growth opportunities for the PC market.

Dell pegs its addressable market in AI hardware and services at $174 billion and growing 22% per year, so investors can justify buying the stock on that opportunity alone. The shares trade at a conservative forward P/E of 16. Analysts expect earnings to increase by 19% in 2025. If investors decide to value the company at a higher P/E, which is possible given the long-term tailwinds in AI, Dell stock could deliver a return that exceeds next year's earnings increase.

title: How AI can help you make a computer game without knowing anything about coding
description: As exciting as all this is, AI coding is still in its infancy. At this stage it can only help non-coders to build simple ...
article_content:
Just as calculators took over the tedious number-crunching in maths a few decades ago, artificial intelligence (AI) is transforming coding. Take Kyo, an eight-year-old boy in Singapore who developed a simple platform game in just two hours, attracting over 500,000 players.

Using nothing but simple instructions in English, Kyo brought his vision to life leveraging the coding app Cursor and also Claude, a general purpose AI. Although his dad is a coder, Kyo didn’t get any help from him to design the game and has no formal coding education himself. He went on to build another game, an animation app, a drawing app and a chatbot, taking about two hours for each.

This shows how AI is dramatically lowering the barrier to software development, bridging the gap between creativity and technical skill. Among the range of apps and platforms dedicated to this purpose, others include Google’s AlphaCode 2 and Replit’s Ghostwriter.

In another example of the power of these apps, an eight-year-old American girl called Fay built a chatbot that purported to be Harry Potter. She had it up and running in just 45 minutes, at which point it asked if she had heard the rumours about the Deathly Hallows and suggested they discuss it over a butterbeer at the Three Broomsticks.

For those that already know how to code, numerous AI apps have become incredibly helpful too. At the other extreme from the natural language coding apps described above, tools like Tabnine and GitHub Copilot act as intelligent assistants, predicting and autocompleting code as you type.

Alternatives such as Sourcery and DeepCode go a step further, offering real-time code cleanup, suggesting improvements and fixing vulnerabilities. New tools are emerging weekly, such as OpenAI’s GPT Canvas, a new GPT version designed to help with sophisticated coding. Many of these tools can also translate code from one programming language to another, say from JavaScript to Python.

The productivity gains that these tools offer are revolutionising the software industry. As many as 70% of companies have already adopted the likes of GitHub Copilot, with coders reporting that AI is enabling them to write software that is more reliable and bug free.

By removing the need to spend so many hours ironing out human errors, coders are able to spend more time focusing on higher value tasks such as designing system architecture and collaborating with colleagues.

It is also changing the game for university educators like myself as we race to keep up. We’ve been having to rethink teaching materials and also assessment methods, wrestling with how exactly to grade a student’s coding in situations where AI tools are doing much of the work.

Today’s limitations

As exciting as all this is, AI coding is still in its infancy. At this stage it can only help non-coders to build simple applications or games. It can’t yet oversee big complex IT projects by understanding the big picture in a way that a human coder would.

It can’t yet invent new ways to solve problems either, and is still more likely to lag in areas like, say, spacecraft navigation that require highly specialised knowledge.

Many tools also don’t write perfect code: a program will often work but won’t be efficient or secure enough for use in the real world. Similarly, AI tools don’t inherently understand the context of the data they process, so may mishandle sensitive information or perpetuate biases present in the data on which they were trained.

For all these reasons, in professional situations there’s still a need for a coder to make sure that everything is meeting the necessary standards. No doubt in future we may see AI coding tools designed to handle everything from security issues to highly specialised subject matter. Their ability to help non-coders to build apps will also only improve. For now at least, however, AI coding is still amplifying the skills of coders rather than replacing them altogether.

How to build your own game

All the same, it’s incredible what you can do with these tools as a non-coder already. Here’s a quick guide to making a simple platform game:

Step 1: Sign up for an AI tool: Create an account with, say, Cursor or AlphaCode 2 and follow the setup instructions. Depending on which tool you choose, you may need to do a quick install. You may also need to install a programming language such as Python, as well as a source code editor such as VS Studio Code 2 – the coding platform will keep you right on this.

Step 2: Start your game: Open a new project in the tool. Into the prompt, type: “Create a simple platform game where the platforms are made of sweet treats”.

Step 3: See what it’s like: Click “run” or “preview” to see what you’ve created (depending on which system you are using, you may have to do this in the source code editor). You should see platforms made of candy or cakes.

Step 4: Make some changes: Let’s say we change the main character into a parrot. Simply type into the prompt: “Make the avatar a green parrot”.

Step 5: Add features: Now type into the prompt: “Let the parrot be controlled by the cursor arrows, insert some sweets for it to collect and add a score counter for how many it has collected”.

Author provided

Step 6: Test and tweak: Click “run” or “preview” again to test the updated game. Make changes by typing things like, “Insert a black crow that will chase the parrot around the screen. If the crow touches the parrot, freeze the screen and display a message in the middle of the screen saying ‘Too Bad!!!’”. Keep repeating these steps until you’re happy with the results.

Step 7: Get it out there: You might now want to share your game with friends or online via an app store. It must be said that AI coders are not yet doing this well, so you may find this trickier without prior knowledge. One option is to deploy the game online via a free platform such as Zeabur, as explained here.

title: How to Deal With AI Job Applications
description: The use of AI by job seekers has increased recently--a symptom of a broken recruiting system. Is there hope that the job search and hiring process will get any better?

title: AI-Powered headshot photography bringing speed convenience and perfection together
description: AI-powered headshot photo applications have recently become an integral part of our lives, completely transforming our ...
article_content:
AI-powered headshot photo applications have recently become an integral part of our lives, completely transforming our photography habits. In the past, getting a headshot photo meant going to a photo studio, adjusting the lighting, and dealing with the background—an exhausting process. Now, these steps are compressed into just a few seconds. In this digital age, even headshot photos come with a fast and practical solution.

These AI-powered applications are so convenient that with just a few clicks, you can instantly create the photo you want. This not only saves a great deal of time but also provides a fantastic solution for those who quickly need professional photos, especially in the business world. After all, we live in a world where many of us need instant headshot photos for job applications, LinkedIn profiles, or official documents. This is where AI steps in, simplifying the entire process.

However, focusing solely on speed and convenience might prevent us from fully grasping how different the experience offered by these AI-powered applications really is. The quality they provide is surprisingly impressive. Algorithms that perfectly recognize facial features automatically adjust the lighting and background. In the past, we had to spend a lot of time with photographers to capture the right angle and lighting. Now, all these steps are completed in the blink of an eye. Many applications even prepare the photos for digital or print formats, making them ready for use in no time.

Of course, this brings the issue of "quality" into question. Compared to traditional studio photos, the ones generated by AI can sometimes be too perfect. These algorithms, which smooth out facial features, occasionally sacrifice natural appearances in favor of artificial perfection. And that’s not always something everyone wants. While some might find this perfection appealing, others may not prefer it because it lacks authenticity. But the primary reason these applications are so popular is that they provide users with convenience and quick results. For example, we can now easily create edgy professional headshots quickly and effectively.

Applications like Portrait Pal are particularly noteworthy for offering this technology in the most efficient way. With various options, they can create photos suitable for any need—whether it’s a serious photo for business use or a more casual, social look. And as a bonus, you get results in just a few minutes. Background selections, clothing coordination, and even natural looks with a slight smile are just a few of the features these apps offer. Especially a slight smile and natural posture can leave a professional impression on LinkedIn and other social media platforms. Similarly, PixelPose stands out as another effective alternative to Portrait Pal.

But at some point, we can't help but question: Does this speed and perfection always yield the desired results? Yes, you get a perfect photo within minutes, but the overly retouched facial features or the overly clean background can sometimes leave a slightly artificial impression. If you're looking for a more natural and personal photo, the smooth results these AI-powered photos offer might not satisfy you. However, if you're in a hurry to submit a job application or update your social media profile, these applications can truly be lifesavers.

The speed and convenience provided by these applications are undeniably a huge advantage. Especially considering how frequently headshot photos are used in the business world or official documents, meeting these needs within minutes thanks to AI is quite appealing. But this speed and convenience can sometimes lead to a lack of personalization. Over-smoothing facial features or overly sterile backgrounds can sometimes make the photos look too artificial. So, balancing speed and quality isn’t always easy.

In conclusion, AI-powered headshot photo applications have created a revolution in terms of speed and convenience. These applications are pushing photography to an entirely different level, making us question traditional methods. Thanks to apps like Portrait Pal, anyone can access professional-quality photos within minutes. Of course, for those seeking naturalness, these results might sometimes feel too smooth. However, overall, it’s clear that these applications will play a more significant role in the future of photography and set professional standards. With technology advancing so rapidly, AI-powered photography seems likely to become an indispensable part of our daily lives in the near future.

This article was written in cooperation with Portrait Pal

title: Beattyville RV park hosting paranormal tours at historic home
description: The owners of an RV park in Lee County are inviting visitors to experience the beauty of Beattyville - but your stay at ...
article_content:
LEE COUNTY, Ky. (LEX 18) — The owners of an RV park in Lee County are inviting visitors to experience the beauty of Beattyville - but your stay at Firefly Hills may also include a brush with the paranormal.

This month, Tonja and Troy Lesmeister are opening up the historic farmhouse to the public for tours during the first Firefly Hills After Dark event.

The first was on Oct. 10, but there will be two more tours happening Oct. 17 and Oct. 24. Get tickets here: Paranormal Tours at the Firefly Hills 1900's Farmhouse Tickets, Multiple Dates | Eventbrite.

Guests will get to use different paranormal investigating equipment as they learn about the Snowden House, which was built 100 years ago.

The Lesmeisters purchased the property in 2022 to start an inclusive RV and glamping park.

Tonja herself is an amateur paranormal investigator who welcomes others to the home, as long as they are respectful of the home's history.

"We take pride in caring for this beautiful piece of property they built," she said. "And I appreciate they're not scaring my guests too much."

Local lore says people have claimed to see a woman in the upstairs window brushing her hair. Others say they've heard voices and rattling doorknobs, or seen the bathtub filling up by itself.

title: Get spooky with the Spirit Seekers
description: People can enjoy history, spooky tales and paranormal equipment this month with the Belmont County Spirit Seekers. The ...
article_content:
ST. CLAIRSVILLE — People can enjoy history, spooky tales and paranormal equipment this month with the Belmont County Spirit Seekers.

The Belmont County Heritage Museum, St. Clairsville Public Library and Spirit Seekers, Tamara Hess and Tracy Johnston are partnering to bring lore, paranormal equipment and history to Belmont County.

“It’s a good way to learn about Belmont County history, too, even though it’s maybe not as serious of a subject,” said Cathryn Stanley, Heritage Museum manager. “But it’s still history, and it’s fun. It appeals to different people.”

The Spirit Seekers, Heritage Museum and library will be presenting “legends, lore and spooky tales about locations from St. Clairsville, Belmont County and notable residents and tragic events of the past” at 6 p.m. Oct. 17 at the library at 108 W. Main St. in St. Clairsville.

After the presentation from the Spirit Seekers, people can take a tour of the library’s behind-the-scenes history and then a walk to the Heritage Museum. There, people can see the Haunted Hills of Belmont County display. The event will have a question-and-answer session with the Spirit Seekers and their paranormal investigative tools people can see. The event will also have refreshments. The Heritage Museum advises this event is not suitable for children under 10.

Stanley said the library has a hidden staircase people will go through for the tour.

The Haunted Hills display has photos of Louiza Fox’s grave, Thomas Carr’s murder weapon that he used and new items to be displayed. Thomas Carr was the first person hanged in Belmont County for murder. His victim was the 13-year-old Fox, who is buried at Salem Cemetery in Egypt Valley.

There will be a lantern tour following at 6 p.m. Oct. 19, with the Spirit Seekers at the St. Clairsville library. This tour includes a walk along Main Street with Spirit Seekers teaching tourists about Sheriff Sam Dunfee, the only sheriff in Belmont County to be killed during active duty, his residence and death; Carr’s burial; Frog Hollow; National Road Tavern and more.

Although registration is full for the lantern walk, people can still join the waiting list and have a chance to enjoy the walk.

The next week, the Spirit Seekers will be at the Belmont County Heritage Museum again from 5:30-8 p.m. Oct. 24 for the annual Halloween Bash put on by the St. Clairsville Area Chamber of Commerce, where the Spirit Seekers will bring their paranormal investigative equipment for participants to use.

“I think the library is a great place for people to learn about local history,” Stanley said. “And people who maybe, even though we’re right across the street from the library, maybe they’ve never been in here.”

title: Yvette Fielding's 'petrifying' ghostly encounter which changed her belief in the afterlife
description: The Most Haunted Star recalls the spectral figure that inspired her spooky Channel 5 series and introduced her to her husband ...
article_content:
Yvette Fielding's ghostly encounter in her mid-20s transformed her life

Until she was 26, former Blue Peter presenter Yvette Fielding didn’t believe in the afterlife. But that all changed the night she awoke to find an eerie figure ­standing at the end of the bed in her mother’s house. She tells me: “I awoke in the middle of the night to discover a young, Second World War soldier staring straight at me from the foot of the bed. It was petrifying.” Even more terrifyingly, rather than being vaporous, the youthful figure – dressed in a brown military uniform with brass buttons, and sporting Brylcreemed hair and a sharp side parting – appeared to have formand substance. “I burst into tears and ran screaming from the bedroom into my mum’s room,” Yvette, now 55, recalls. “Imagine, as a young woman, awaking to discover a man in your room. But although it was like looking at a solid object, he was only there from the waist up – his top half was hovering. I was sobbing, ‘There’s a ghost in the house’.” The experience was destined to change the shape of Yvette’s life – revealing a new direction in her broadcasting career that continues to this day, as well as helping introduce her to her second husband, TV producer Karl Beattie. Most Haunted, the paranormal research series presented by Yvette and a gang of experts, and produced by Karl, is now filming its 26th season. Yvette explains that her compulsion for the paranormal turned from terror into fascination following a grim discovery made after her haunting experience. “Mum and I felt compelled to research the young man in uniform,” she tells me. They started by talking to the neighbours. “There were only five houses in the road, and we discovered that a couple of them had seen exactly the same thing,”she explains. Things then became even stranger still when they dug deeper and spoke to anolder resident. “Behind the houses was a wood, and beyond that, the Manchester to London ­railway line. “I spoke to a neighbour who said that during the war, the young soldiers were sent south by railway to fight, but one young conscript had thrown himself off the train as he didn’t want to go, and was cut in half by the train.” Convinced that this explained the apparition that had so alarmed her, fearturned into fascination. “That first-hand experience has now led me on a journey that has become such a huge passion, and it has actually changed my entire life,” Yvette reflects. “Before this experience, I didn’t believe in anything. I didn’t believe in a God. I didn’t believe in life after death and those feelings affected me in a negative way because when I had the usual share of awful times, as we all do, I would wonder what life is all about, why are we here, where did we come from and is that it when you’re put in the ground at the end and it all goes black?”

Yvette Fielding and husband Karl

Now Yvette’s latest children’s book, about haunted castles, has just been published, mining her on-camera experiences and bringing them to life in spooky fashion for a brand new audience of young readers. And it was shortly after meeting Karl that she discovered he had also had a similar experience to her; a fact that proved to be deeply bonding. “When I met my beautiful husband, he had had his own haunted experiences,” she tells me. Karl takes over the tale: “One night, when I was about 10 and my brother was five, I saw a man wearing a fedora hat and dressed in a 1930s costume, leaning on my bedroom door frame.” As with Yvette’s visitor, he was similarly solid but faded over the next few minutes. Says Karl: “I thought I may have dreamed it, but it was only in the morning when we got up for breakfast that my little brother said that he had got really scared in the night because there was a man leaning on the wall in a Humphrey Bogart outfit. He was so young that this detail made me think there had to be some truth to what we had both seen.” When the couple, who have been married for 25 years and have a daughter, Mary, met on the set of BBC One’s documentary series City Hospital, they soon found themselves sharing their experiences. Says Karl: “Yvette and I connected on so many levels when we met, and had this sense that we had met each other before and when I talked about this experience, she took me seriously. We were both used to people being sceptical.” Yvette, who also has a son, Will, from a previous marriage, says that this led them to become ­increasingly intrigued to the point that they came up with the idea for the TV series. Sheadds: “We were so passionate about the topic that we spent all our life savings making the pilot and for a while we couldn’t pay the mortgage.”

Trending

Worryingly, all the mainstream TV ­stations turned it down. “Channel 5 even called us ‘unprofessional’ for delving into this genre,” she recalls. “But something in us kept pushing until the satellite station UK Living said yes.” At the time, the station was losing viewers, but the couple were told “this might be just mad enough to work”. Sixteen initial episodes were commissioned, and Yvette found herself launched professionally into the world of the paranormal. “We don’t know all the answers and the only experts are those who have passed on,” she says now. “But I definitely call myself a paranormal researcher.” And as she gazes into the camera, often in the eerie black and white world created by heat-seeking night vision cameras, she says she never forgets the advice she was given as a 19-year-old presenting rookie by Biddy Baxter, the legendary Blue Peter producer. “One thing Biddy always said was that it is so important just to be yourself as a presenter. She said, ‘Never, ever when you look in the camera, think of a lot of people. Just think of one, your best friend, and you are trying to talk to them’.” It’s advice she continues to heed. “I think it’s really important for presenters to remember that. Audiences are not daft, they know who a genuine person is.”

Caron Keating, Mark Curry and Yvette Fielding on Blue Peter in 1995

title: Turkish discovery officially recognized as 'asteroid'
description: In 2021, during space observation and research activities at the Düzce Science and Art Center (BILSEM), a celestial body ...
article_content:
In 2021, during space observation and research activities at the Düzce Science and Art Center (BILSEM), a celestial body identified as an "asteroid" was confirmed. This asteroid is categorized as a fragment of rock and metal that orbits the sun.

The project was led by Ayşe Arslan, a science teacher at Düzce BILSEM who has been engaged in space observation for five years, along with Ömer Selim Esen, a 14-year-old ninth grade student at Düzce Turgut Özal Anadolu High School. Their work was part of the "Asteroid Discovery Campaign," supported by the International Astronomical Search Collaboration (IASC).

As part of this initiative, amateur astronomers sought to identify new asteroids. Arslan and Esen successfully detected a celestial body in 2021, which was subsequently registered as a new asteroid by the IASC. This significant discovery also granted them the privilege of naming the asteroid.

Significance of discovery

Ayşe Arslan shared her excitement with Anadolu Agency (AA), noting that after their application to the Asteroid Discovery Campaign was accepted, they began their observations using data sets provided to them. They utilized specialized software to analyze the data and submitted their reports to the Minor Planet Center of the IASC.

After three years of awaiting confirmation, they received an email notifying them that the celestial body they discovered was the first asteroid identified by Turkish researchers. Arslan emphasized the scientific value of this discovery, stating, "The identification of this asteroid marks the first time a celestial body has been discovered in the solar system by Turkish researchers, which is incredibly significant for both us and Türkiye."

Ömer Selim Esen expressed his pride in their discovery, recalling, "We discovered this asteroid three years ago. A long time has passed, but I still remember that moment vividly. It is very valuable to me." Driven by his curiosity about astronomy, Esen has been involved in various projects at BILSEM for seven years.

title: Traqo Raises Pre-Seed Funding to Revolutionize Logistics with No-Code
description: Traqo raises pre-seed funding led by We Founder Circle to enhance its no-code logistics platform, streamlining operations and ...
article_content:
Traqo.io, a no-code platform specialising in third-party logistics management, is making headlines with its recent pre-seed funding round. The round was led by We Founder Circle, marking a significant milestone for Traqo as they aim to streamline logistics operations using cutting-edge technology and AI capabilities.

Advertisment

Traqo is not just another logistics platform; it promises to revolutionize how logistics is managed. With its no-code Software as a Service (SaaS) model, Traqo is designed to eliminate manual processes like spreadsheets and reduce operational inefficiencies. Their goal? To bring real-time, integrated management solutions to logistics companies, enhancing transparency and scalability.

The Recent Pre-Seed Funding Round

The exact amount of the funds raised in the pre-seed round remains undisclosed, but the investment led by We Founder Circle is expected to fuel Traqo's expansion efforts. The funds will play a crucial role in building the company’s AI capabilities and tech team.

Advertisment

Founders and Leadership Team

Traqo was founded by Mukesh Deogune, an IIT BHU alumnus, along with a team that brings rich experience from top organizations like Microsoft, HSBC, and Reliance. Their combined expertise is helping to build a robust platform that has already gained traction within the logistics industry.

What Traqo Offers

Advertisment

Traqo’s SaaS-based platform is a game-changer for logistics, covering the entire freight lifecycle—from procurement and tracking to auditing and settlement. It’s designed to be 10x faster and more cost-effective than other logistics solutions on the market, providing manufacturers and logistics stakeholders with powerful tools to optimize their operations.

Challenges in Traditional Logistics Management

Traditional logistics management systems are bogged down by manual processes like data entry, resulting in inefficiencies and increased costs. Traqo addresses these pain points by offering automated, integrated solutions that provide real-time insights.

Advertisment

How Traqo is Solving Logistics Problems

Traqo eliminates the need for spreadsheets and manual work, automating logistics management through a unified platform. Their SaaS solution streamlines operations, making logistics up to 10 times faster and significantly cheaper. This is particularly valuable for manufacturers and e-commerce businesses seeking to optimize their freight lifecycle.

AI Capabilities and Tech Expansion

Advertisment

With the recent infusion of funds, Traqo plans to expand its AI-driven features. The company aims to give businesses full visibility and control over their logistics operations, ensuring greater efficiency and scalability. AI will play a key role in route optimization, load planning, and real-time monitoring, making logistics more efficient than ever before.

Mukesh Deogune, Founder of Traqo.io, shared his vision: "Traqo is enabling logistics stakeholders to manage their operations on a single, neutral platform, ensuring greater transparency, efficiency, and scalability. With the backing of We Founder Circle, we are set to expand our AI-driven features and empower businesses to gain full visibility and control over their logistics."

We Founder Circle has recognized the potential of Traqo’s no-code platform to reshape the logistics industry. Neeraj Tyagi, Co-Founder & CEO of We Founder Circle, stated: "Solving a real-world problem, Traqo's no-code platform has the potential to redefine how logistics is managed across sectors, offering businesses the ability to optimize every aspect of their freight lifecycle."

Advertisment

No-Code SaaS Platform Features

The platform is built with easy-to-customize, drag-and-drop modules that enable freight procurement, trip planning, SLA management, fund auditing, and invoicing. This no-code system ensures that businesses can adapt the software to meet their unique needs without requiring technical expertise.

Technological Edge of Traqo

Advertisment

Traqo integrates advanced tracking technologies, using SIM-based tracking, GPS, and toll gate data to provide real-time monitoring of shipments. Their AI-based trip planner allows for route optimization and 3D load optimization, enabling businesses to cut costs and improve operational efficiencies.

Growth and Market Opportunities

Currently, Traqo has onboarded over 51 SMEs and is growing at a rate of 3x year over year. The company is targeting a Total Addressable Market (TAM) of $215 billion, with opportunities to expand both across India and globally.

The recent funding will be used to scale Traqo’s AI capabilities and strengthen its tech team. The company aims to enhance its platform to meet the growing demands for efficient logistics solutions, particularly in the manufacturing and e-commerce sectors. Their pay-as-you-go subscription model also makes their solution accessible to businesses of all sizes.

Conclusion

Traqo is poised to redefine the logistics industry with its no-code SaaS platform. By automating and streamlining key operations, Traqo offers manufacturers and logistics companies a faster, more efficient way to manage their freight lifecycle. With its AI-driven approach and strong leadership, Traqo is set to be a game-changer in the sector.

title: How to Build a SaaS Factory – Ship 10x Faster
description: Unlock rapid SaaS innovation with reusable code and no-code automation. Learn how the SaaS Factory model can transform your ...
article_content:
Wouldn’t it be great to be capable of transforming your innovative ideas into market-ready software solutions at lightning speed, without the usual headaches and setbacks. In the fast-paced world of Software as a Service (SaaS), where the pressure to innovate is relentless, the concept of a “SaaS Factory” offers a refreshing approach. This isn’t just about cranking out products faster; it’s about creating a finely-tuned system that uses reusable code, no-code automation, and streamlined processes to turn your creative visions into reality with unprecedented efficiency. Whether you’re a seasoned entrepreneur or just starting out, the high failure rate of SaaS products is a daunting reality. But what if there was a way to significantly tilt the odds in your favor?

SaaS Factory

Enter the SaaS Factory model—a fantastic option for anyone looking to navigate the turbulent waters of product development. By focusing on rapid iteration and continuous testing, this approach not only accelerates the journey from concept to launch but also enhances your ability to adapt and pivot in response to market feedback. Imagine having a toolkit that includes everything from GitHub-managed reusable code libraries to no-code automation tools like Zapier, all designed to streamline your operations and boost your productivity.

TL;DR Key Takeaways : A “SaaS Factory” approach enhances product development speed and success by focusing on reusable code, no-code automation, and streamlined processes.

Effective code management and reusability are central, utilizing platforms like GitHub to organize reusable code and templates, minimizing the need to start from scratch.

No-code automation tools, such as Zapier, automate repetitive tasks, allowing for quick deployment of solutions and freeing up time for innovation.

Creative resources and design tools like Figma and Adobe After Effects provide reusable graphics and templates, ensuring consistent branding and rapid development.

Establishing operational protocols and a personal playbook ensures quality, consistency, and strategic guidance, fostering innovation and adaptability in the SaaS landscape.

As you dive into the details of building your own SaaS Factory, you’ll discover how to harness these resources to not only speed up development but also maintain high standards of quality and creativity. By utilising reusable components, using no-code automation, and implementing streamlined processes, organizations can dramatically enhance both the speed and success rate of their product launches.

Decoding the SaaS Factory Paradigm

At its core, the SaaS Factory model is built on the principle of rapid iteration and continuous testing of new ideas. Even the most experienced entrepreneurs in the SaaS space face high failure rates when launching new products. The factory approach addresses this challenge by creating a systematic framework that allows for:

Faster concept-to-launch cycles

Increased efficiency in resource utilization

Greater adaptability to market feedback

Improved ability to pivot quickly when necessary

This methodology prioritizes agility and scalability, allowing teams to respond swiftly to changing market demands and user needs.

Mastering Code Management and Reusability

The foundation of an effective SaaS Factory lies in robust code management practices. Platforms like GitHub serve as invaluable tools for organizing and maintaining reusable code repositories and templates. By implementing a modular approach to development, teams can:

Create a library of reusable components and boilerplates

Ensure consistency across multiple projects

Significantly reduce development time for new features

Minimize the need to start from scratch with each new product

This approach not only accelerates development but also enhances code quality and maintainability over time.

Harnessing the Power of No-Code Automation

No-code automation tools have become indispensable in the modern SaaS Factory. Platforms like Zapier and Microsoft Power Automate enable teams to:

Automate repetitive tasks and workflows

Integrate various systems and applications seamlessly

Develop and deploy solutions without extensive coding expertise

Rapidly prototype and test new features

By creating a library of reusable no-code templates, organizations can further streamline their operations, allowing for quick deployment of common functionalities across different products.

Building a SaaS Factory

Take a look at other insightful guides from our broad collection that might capture your interest.

Optimizing Creative Resources and Design

A well-organized creative library is crucial for maintaining brand consistency and accelerating the design process. Tools like Figma and Adobe Creative Suite enable design teams to:

Create and store reusable graphics, icons, and UI components

Develop standardized design systems

Collaborate effectively on visual elements

Rapidly iterate on product designs

This approach ensures that design resources are readily available, maintaining a cohesive brand image across all products while significantly reducing time-to-market.

Implementing Robust Operational Protocols

Establishing clear operational protocols is essential for maintaining quality and consistency in a SaaS Factory environment. Key elements include:

Comprehensive checklists for new product setups

Standardized documentation practices

Quality control measures and testing protocols

Clear communication channels and feedback loops

These protocols ensure that all team members adhere to best practices, facilitating early identification and resolution of potential issues throughout the development lifecycle.

Crafting a Personalized Strategic Playbook

Developing a personalized playbook is crucial for long-term success in the SaaS Factory model. This strategic guide should:

Document successful strategies and lessons learned

Outline decision-making frameworks for common scenarios

Provide guidelines for resource allocation and prioritization

Serve as a living document, updated regularly with new insights

By creating a custom factory approach rather than relying solely on pre-made solutions, organizations gain deeper understanding and control over their processes, leading to more informed decision-making and strategic planning.

Key Insights from Building a SaaS Factory

Constructing a SaaS Factory from the ground up offers invaluable lessons and benefits:

Enhanced adaptability to market changes and user feedback

Improved innovation capabilities through rapid prototyping and testing

Greater control over product development processes

Increased ability to scale operations efficiently

By focusing on refining the process rather than relying on off-the-shelf solutions, organizations can develop a competitive edge in the dynamic SaaS landscape.

In conclusion, the SaaS Factory model represents a powerful framework for accelerating product development in the digital age. By using reusable code, embracing no-code automation, and implementing organized protocols, organizations can significantly enhance their efficiency and increase their chances of success in the highly competitive SaaS industry. This approach not only speeds up the development process but also fosters a culture of continuous improvement and innovation, essential for thriving in today’s fast-paced technological environment.

title: Best Small Business Startup Loans
description: Even if your company only has six months to one year of time in business, you can still get a business loan. Check out the ...
article_content:
Startups can qualify for several types of small business loans. As long as you have enough time in business and can meet other requirements, you can use startup loans for a wide range of business goals.

Working capital loan (business line of credit)

A small business line of credit or "working capital loan" can be a great choice for small business startup loans. This type of business loan gives your startup a flexible line of credit that works in the same way as a small business credit card.

Most working capital loans can be paid off in a flexible way (based on the lender's terms). This flexibility is especially important for startup loans, because it can help your growing business conserve cash when you need it, or replenish your available line of credit faster if you choose.

Small business term loan for startups

Working capital loans are often available in the form of a flexible revolving line of credit. But if your startup is ready to borrow a larger amount of funding for big goals like purchasing equipment or investing in new facilities, a small business term loan can give your startup long-term cash.

Here's the biggest difference between a small business line of credit and a small business term loan: A small business line of credit is like a credit card, and a term loan is like a mortgage. Because small business term loans tend to have larger loan amounts, fixed monthly payments, and longer durations, term loans might also have more favorable APRs.

Some small business term loans are harder for young companies to qualify for -- your startup might need to have at least two years in business before you can get the best rates on a small business term loan. And many small business term loans require the business owner to offer a personal guarantee, or put up collateral such as equipment or property owned by the business.

SBA loans for startups

SBA loans can be a good choice for startups because they're supported by the Small Business Administration (SBA). This government backing helps make SBA loans available to a wider range of businesses, including newer businesses, that might not qualify for traditional bank business loans. Even startup founders with bad credit can qualify for SBA loans.

Be aware that with SBA loans for startups, the loan amounts might be smaller than you prefer, and the application process is not always fast. It might take a few months for your SBA startup loan application to get reviewed and approved. If your startup needs money sooner, the best fast small business loans for quick funding could be a better choice.

Equipment financing for startups

Some banks and lenders offer special business loans designed for purchasing equipment. Equipment financing for startups can help your company buy new computers, office furniture, machinery for a contracting business, professional kitchen appliances for a restaurant, and any other equipment that your business might need.

Similar to buying a car with an auto loan, some equipment loans will even use the newly purchased equipment as collateral to secure the loan -- which can help your business qualify for a lower APR.

Global Simulation Software Market is flourishing due to the increasing demand for efficiency and optimization and growing awareness about the benefits of simulations.

Report Ocean, a leading strategic consulting and market research firm, in its recent study, estimated the Global Simulation Software Market size at USD 12.13 billion in 2023. During the forecast period between 2024 and 2030, Report Ocean expects the Global Simulation Software Market size to expand at a CAGR of 10.6% reaching a value of USD 24.56 billion by 2030. The Global Simulation Software Market is propelled by the rising preference for simulation software to optimize the performance of electric-autonomous vehicles and the increasing adoption of simulation tools in the healthcare industry. The advantages offered by simulation software solutions, including significant cost savings in product development, reduced training expenses, and improved quality and productivity of equipment, contribute to widespread adoption of simulation software across various industries. Manufacturing entities, for instance, leverage simulation to digitally prototype equipment, allowing for thorough testing of functionality, quality, and operability even before physical development. The proactive approach aids in minimizing product recall scenarios, a critical concern for companies. Also, other key drivers fostering the growth of the Global Simulation Software Market include a notable surge in its application in the healthcare sector, alongside increasing utilization in automotive, electronics, and aerospace industries. Consequently, the expanding use of simulations across diverse applications, encompassing Engineering, Research, Modeling & Simulated Testing, Manufacturing Process Optimization, High Fidelity Experiential 3D Training, further underscores the market’s growth trajectory during the period in analysis.

Get a Free Sample PDF copy of the report @https://reportocean.com/industry-verticals/sample-request?report_id=bwcc18896

Opportunity – Growing adoption of advancements in technology

The growing popularity of simulation software across various industry verticals is marked by significant advancements in simulation technology. Organizations increasingly utilize simulation tools to analyze and optimize performance, predict maintenance requirements, and simulate diverse scenarios. Notably, Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) are now integral to simulation tools, enhancing predictive capabilities, automating processes, and optimizing simulations. AI-powered algorithms analyze extensive amounts of simulation-generated data, empowering organizations to gain insights, make data-driven decisions, and enhance overall simulation performance. Furthermore, the integration of Virtual Reality (VR) and Augmented Reality (AR) technologies with simulation tools adds immersive and interactive dimensions. VR and AR provide users with intuitive and engaging visualization and interaction experiences, finding applications in training, education, design, and various industries, including automotive, manufacturing, and healthcare.

Impact of Geopolitical Tensions on Global Simulation Software Market

Geopolitical tensions exert a multifaceted impact on the Global Simulation Software Market. As countries navigate conflicts and security challenges, there is an increased demand for simulation tools in defense and security sectors, fostering preparedness and strategic planning. Market dynamics are influenced by uncertainties, potentially altering investment patterns and priorities. Disruptions in the global supply chain, stemming from trade conflicts or sanctions, may affect the hardware components essential for simulation systems. Cybersecurity simulations become increasingly pivotal as the digital realm witnesses a surge in threats amid geopolitical tensions. Collaborative research initiatives, regulatory frameworks, and government funding for simulation technologies may experience recalibrations aligned with geopolitical considerations. Industries linked to defense, aerospace, and critical infrastructure encounter more pronounced effects, with the geographic focus of simulation software development potentially undergoing alterations in response to geopolitical developments.

Global Simulation Software Market



Segmental Information



Global Simulation Software Market – By End Use

On the basis of end use, the Global Simulation Software Market is segmented into Automotive, Aerospace & Defense, Industrial, Electronics & Semiconductor, Transportation & Logistics, and Healthcare segments. The automotive segment holds the highest share in the Global Simulation Software Market by end use. The automotive industry is undergoing a transformative shift, incorporating various technologies across its value chain. Notably, macro trends like the rise of autonomous vehicles and the push for more efficient, electric alternatives drive the growing demand for simulation in the sector.

For an in-depth analysis, you can refer sample copy of the report @https://reportocean.com/industry-verticals/sample-request?report_id=bwcc18896

Simultaneously, traditional applications of vehicle simulation remain widely accepted. Originally limited to specific aspects of vehicle design, high-performance computer (HPC) simulation, facilitated by computer-aided engineering (CAE) applications, has evolved to enhance all facets of product development, including manufacturing processes. The CAE simulation tools, initially used in vehicle design, now dictate the most efficient and cost-effective manufacturing processes, proving especially crucial with the introduction of new materials like aluminum and plastics. Simulation enables manufacturers to circumvent the costly trial-and-error method in establishing production processes for new vehicles.

Global Simulation Software Market – By Region

The in-depth research report on the Global Simulation Software Market covers the market in a number of major countries across five regions: North America, Europe, Asia Pacific, Latin America, and Middle East and Africa. The North America region dominates the market and is expected to maintain its dominance during the forecast period. It is primarily due to the significant presence of key players in the United States and Canada. Companies in these countries are actively engaging in research and development endeavors to unveil technologically advanced products. Additionally, North America is renowned for its early adoption of innovative technologies.

Competitive Landscape

The Global Simulation Software Market is fragmented, with numerous players serving the market. The key players dominating the Global Simulation Software Market include Ansys Inc, Autodesk Inc, Altair Engineering Inc, Dassault Syst?mes, Siemens AG, Rockwell Automation Inc, Schneider Electric SE, ESI Group SA, Bentley Systems Inc, MathWorks Inc, GSE Systems Inc, and Simulations Plus Inc. The key marketing strategies adopted by the players are facility expansion, product diversification, alliances, collaborations, partnerships, and acquisitions to expand their customer reach and gain a competitive edge in the overall market.

It also highlights the factors driving forecasts of total market size. The report promises to provide recent technology trends in the Global Simulation Software Market along with industry insights to help decision-makers make sound strategic decisions.
